results.title: Alex Jones, Under Questioning, Is Confronted With Evidence of Deception
results.abstract: The Infowars conspiracy theorist was presented with text messages from his own cellphone that his lawyers appeared to have accidentally sent to lawyers for Sandy Hook parents.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Monkeypox;Epidemics;Vaccination and Immunization;Health and Human Services Department;World Health Organization
results.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Apoorva Mandavilli
results.title: As Monkeypox Spreads, U.S. Declares a Health Emergency
results.abstract: The designation will free up emergency funds and lift some bureaucratic hurdles, but many experts fear containment may no longer be possible.

media.caption: A monkeypox vaccination at a clinic on Fire Island in New York this month. As of Wednesday, the United States had recorded nearly 7,000 monkeypox cases.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Black Lives Matter Movement;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Taylor, Breonna (1993-2020);Garland, Merrick B;Police Department (Louisville, Ky);Louisville (Ky)
results.title: Federal Officials Charge Four Officers in Breonna Taylor Raid
results.abstract: The police in Louisville, Ky., fatally shot Ms. Taylor during a nighttime raid on her apartment. Prosecutors said officers had lied in order to obtain a search warrant for Ms. Taylor’s home.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Parenting;Actors and Actresses;Content Type: Personal Profile;Cosgrove, Miranda;Grande, Ariana;McCurdy, Jennette (1992- );Nickelodeon
results.title: Jennette McCurdy Is Ready to Move Forward, and to Look Back
results.abstract: In her memoir, “I’m Glad My Mom Died,” McCurdy, best known for her role in“iCarly,” reflects on her time as a child actor and on her troubled relationship with her mother.

media.caption: Jennette McCurdy’s relationship with her mother is the narrative force at the center of her memoir: “It’s the heartbeat of my life.”
media.copyright: Ahmed Gaber for The New York Times

results.byline: By Chris Buckley, Amy Chang Chien, Eric Schmitt and David E. Sanger
results.title: Chinese Missiles Strike Seas Off Taiwan, and Some Land Near Japan
results.abstract: A day after Nancy Pelosi’s trip, China has begun military drills near Taiwan. They appear to be designed as a trial run for sealing off the island. Five missiles landed in Japanese waters.

results.title: A Stranger Filmed Her on the Train. TikTok Users Decided She Had Monkeypox.
results.abstract: With little government guidance on a fast-spreading virus, a new form of social-media vigilantism has emerged.

media.caption: In a TikTok video, Lilly Simon was filmed without her consent and accused of having monkeypox.
media.copyright: Marcus Maddox for The New York Times

results.title: G.O.P. Governors Cause Havoc by Busing Migrants to East Coast
results.abstract: Thousands of migrants have been arriving on buses sent by the governors of Texas and Arizona. Many have ended up in homeless shelters and on the streets.

media.caption: Migrants exiting a charter bus from Texas outside the U.S. Capitol in Washington in July.

results.title: ID Theft, Fraud, Prison: The Wild Life of a Bishop Robbed at the Pulpit
results.abstract: The police said Bishop Lamor Whitehead was robbed of a fortune in jewelry, the crime caught on camera. But the focus soon turned to him and his past run-ins with the law.

media.caption: Bishop Lamor Whitehead, who was robbed during a service at his church, returned on Sunday to deliver a sermon.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.title: The Cartwheel Galaxy Is the Webb Telescope’s Latest Cosmic Snapshot
results.abstract: Scientists gained new insights into the distant object, which got its distinctive shape from a collision with another galaxy.

media.caption: The James Webb Space Telescope recorded new images of the Cartwheel galaxy. This one is a composite made with two tools, the Near-Infrared Camera and the Mid-Infrared Instrument.

results.abstract: After a broad victory in a deep-red state, Democrats are vowing to elevate the fight over abortion rights in midterm races across the country.

results.title: Don’t Call It a Swimming Pool
results.abstract: Plunge pools have become an alternative for homeowners who want a simple, less expensive way to cool off.

media.caption: “We really wanted just a ‘cocktail pool’ that we could dip in, have some drinks, have some friends over. We just didn’t want a big pool,” said homeowner Amy Holland, whose plunge pool (seen here) did not interfere with the lengthy root system of the 100-year-old live oak on the property.

results.title: A ‘Reversible’ Form of Death? Scientists Revive Cells in Dead Pigs’ Organs.
results.abstract: Researchers who previously revived some brain cells in dead pigs succeeded in repeating the process in more organs.

media.caption: Researchers said they hoped to increase the supply of human organs for transplant by allowing doctors to obtain viable organs long after death.

results.title: What puts someone at risk of catching monkeypox?
results.abstract: Here is what experts say about how the virus is transmitted during everyday interactions — and which behaviors carry the most risk.

results.title: Jackie Walorski, Indiana Congresswoman, Is Killed in Car Crash

results.title: Russia’s Shortfalls Create an Opportunity for Ukraine, Western Officials Say

results.byline: By Mike Ives and Jenny Gross
results.title: A Large Object Landed on His Sheep Farm. It Came From Space.
results.abstract: “It’s not something you see every day on a sheep farm,” a farmer said of the pieces of debris that wound up in rural Australia. They are thought to be from a SpaceX spacecraft.

media.caption: A sheepherder in Dalgety, Australia, stumbled upon a tall piece of space junk, said to be debris from the SpaceX Crew-1 spacecraft.
